dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Graves of Louisiana (for himself and Mr. Carbajal) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To establish a program to use anonymized data from third-party entities to inform infrastructure planning decisions and to improve transportation management capabilities and efficiency on Federal-aid highways, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Intelligent Transportation Integration Act.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Transportation shall establish and implement a program (in this section referred to as the program) to leverage anonymized data from third-party entities to improve transportation management capabilities and efficiency on Federal-aid highways.
In carrying out the program, the Secretary shall leverage anonymized data derived from third-party entities—

paragraph.text: to inform infrastructure planning decisions relating to—
to implement integrated traffic management systems that leverage real-time data to provide dynamic and efficient traffic flow management for the purposes of—

subparagraph.text: adjusting traffic light cycle times to optimize traffic management and decrease congestion;
expanding or contracting lane capacity to meet traffic demand;
enhancing traveler notification of service conditions;
prioritizing high-priority vehicles such as emergency response and law enforcement within the transportation system; and
responding to severe weather events or conducting emergency evacuations; and

paragraph.text: for any other purpose the Secretary determines is necessary to improve transportation management capabilities and efficiency on Federal-aid highways.
In carrying out the program, the Secretary is authorized to enter into agreements with public and private sector entities to accomplish the purposes described in subsection (b).
Any agreement entered into under paragraph (1) between the Secretary and a data provider shall—

subparagraph.text: be disclosed to the public; and
include provisions that require the use of data protections for user privacy.

paragraph.text: In carrying out the program, the Secretary shall consult with at least 1 organization that supports the development of intelligent transportation systems in the public and private sectors.

subsection.text: In carrying out the program, the Secretary shall ensure—

paragraph.text: the protection of privacy for all sources of data utilized in the program by—

subparagraph.text: precluding the collection of biometric or automatic license plate reader data; and
preventing data utilized in the program from being used by any government entity for any purpose other than the purposes described in subsection (b); and

paragraph.text: the accuracy of data utilized in the program by preventing—

subparagraph.text: hacking, spoofing, and disruption of connected and automated transportation systems; and
the incorporation of inaccurate data, including data generated by artificial intelligence.

subsection.text: In carrying out the program, the Secretary shall enter into agreements with public and private sector entities serving a variety of areas, including urban, suburban, rural, tribal, or any other appropriate settings.

Not later than 3 years after date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall publicly make available best practices to leverage private user data to support improved transportation management capabilities and efficiency, including—

paragraph.text: legal considerations when acquiring private user data for public purposes; and
protecting privacy and security of individual user data.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall submit an annual report to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate detailing—

paragraph.text: a description of the activities carried out under the program;
an evaluation of the effectiveness of the program in meeting the purposes described in subsection (b);
policy recommendations to improve the implementation of anonymized data into planning decisions; and
a description of costs associated with equipping and maintaining integrated traffic management systems.
